result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alexander R Lilja

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Alexander R Lilja
Current: 1515 North Fremont Street, Chicago, IL 60642 United States  (Effective: 01-04-2021)
Prior: 405 Willow St #1, Baraboo, WI 53913 United States

17CF65, 16CM4, 16CF147, 16CF59:  Defendant appears in person with counsel SPD William Poss.  Special Prosecutor Noel Lawrence appears for the State.  Defendant will waive right o preliminary hearing in 17CF65 and there is also a Statement to Negotiated Plea being filed.  There is also a joint recommendation for sentence.

17CF65:  Court performs collquy with defendant regarding his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant states he wishes to waive his right to the preliminary hearing.  Court finds he FVKI  waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  State will e-file the Information with same charge as complaint.  Defense waives reading of the Information.  

16CF59:  There is a VIS on file with the Court.  State has complied with victim rights notification.  He will plea to Count 1 as 4th Degree Sexual Assault, Class A, misdemeanor.  Amended complaint was filed earlier today.  Will also plea to 17CF65, Count 1. 

Plea to Count 1 in 16CF59, 4th Degree Sexual Assault, misdemeanor - Guilty.  Court reviews elements.  17CF65, Count 1 - Bailjumping:  Plea of guilty.  Court reviews elements.  All other counts and cases will be DRI.  Court performs plea/waiver of rights colloquy with defendant.  Felony warning given.  Defense stipulates to the factual basis found in the complaints to support his pleas.  Defense has reviewed the Victim Impact Statement filed previously.  Court finds he FVKI enters his pleas/waives his rights, a factual basis exists and he is found guilty.   All remaining charges and cases are dismissed and read-in.

Victim's mother makes a victim impact statement to the Court.  Restitution will be held open and addressed on a later date or a stipulation will be filed.  State to get the restitution paperwork to Attorney Poss by next week.  Attorney Poss is to schedule a restitution hearing immedately after reviewing the restitutuion request.

State recommends probation for sentencing with conditions:  Sex offender treatment and counseling. Must register as a sex offender for the first 2 years of probation term.  No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18.  No contact with the victim in 16CF59, her family, or her employment if she becomes employed in the future.  Must get an STD test and provide the results to the victim's family.  Must comply with any other recommendations of probation agent.  

Court orders the sex offender expert assessment/report dated 9-7-17 to be made part of the record and defense will file a Motion and Order to Seal.  Attorney Poss makes statement to the Court and agrees with the recommendation for sex offender probation.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution and makes a statement to the Court.

Court adopts the joint recommendation, withholds sentence and places on 2 years probation on 16CF59 and 3 years probation on 17CF65, concurrent with conditions:  Must participate in Sex Offender Registry with the Department of Corrections.  No unsupervised contact with any females under the age of 18, including on the internet or social media of any kind.  No contact allowed with the victim, K.F., her family, or place of employment if she becomes employed.  Not to be at her school if she's present unless approved by probation agent.  Contact allowed if victim or her family requests it through probation agent and it is approved by that agent.  Must submit to an STD test and provide the results to the victim's family.  Must comply with any other recomendations of your probation agent for programming/treatment/counseling.  Must submit a DNA sample.  Must maintain absolute sobriety.  Not to possess and drugs, or paraphernalia.  Not to consume any alcohol or be present where sold/served.  Must submit to random testing by probation agent.  Must submit to an AODA assessment and must comply with any recommended treatment/counseling/programming.  Must sign all releases of information for agent to verify compliance.  Must submit to a risk and needs assesment and comply with all recommendations of your agent.  Must continue treatment with Ron McGuire and any other related treatment of that type as deemed appropriate by your agent.  Must obtain/maintain employment of at least 35 hours per week unless agent deems should be less.  May apply for expungment if complies with all probation conditions and successfully completes probation.  Must pay the court costs during the term of probation.  16CF59 only:  90 days jail stayed if the no contact prohibitions are complied with regarding underage females.

Restitution will be held open at this time.

Attorney Poss requests the following language be included in the JOC:  Pursuant to Section 973.048(1m)(b), the Court finds the defendant was under the age of 21 at the time of the offense.  The defendant shall be released from the reporting requirements under Section 301.45 upon successfully completing the probation period of two years imposed for this offense.  Judge approved this request and ordered it be added to the JOC.

Defendant appears with counsel SPD William Poss.  Special Prosecutor Noel Lawrence appears by phone.  Miscellaneous cases, and they will all be set for plea and sentencing, not on a Monday for approximately an hour.  Attorney Poss will schedule with J.A.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 8, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  State has a new referral.  They haven't made a charging decision yet.  16CF59 to be set for 2 day trial.  Defense not waiving any motion for specific performance.  16CF147 needs to be set for waiver and arraignment.  Track 16CM04.
Status conference on April 3, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared person and with Attorney Poss.  State's Motion for special prosecutor.  Defense has the motion.  Defense opposes the motion.  If the motion is granted, defense will file a motion for specific performance.  Attorney Radcliffe is advocating for the victim's rights.  State made a statement.  Attorney Radcliffe responded.  Victim's family willing to cooperate with the State.  Attorney Radcliffe does not believe there is a conflict.  Court does not see a conflict.  Court denied State's motion.  STC set for 4/3 at 4 pm.
Motion hearing on March 6, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Sex offender assessment completed by the defendant.  State requested more information from the doctor and has not received it yet.  Court noted the victim impact statement filing this morning.  State responded.  Attorney Radcliffe spoke in court.  Representing the victim's family.  DA Fox also responded.  Court said that victims family needs to know what the district attorney's office position is.  ADA Inlow will follow up with the doctor.  Attorney Poss received the victim impact statement before court.  Defense has been ready to proceed.  Attorney Poss made statement regarding the plea negotiations with the State.  Client has complied fully with the evaluation.  They can rectify issues the State has brought up with the doctor.  Want a full and complete victim impact statement at least 5 days before the rescheduled court date.  Sentencing memorandum may be appropriate.  Asks for time to file that if the court reschedules the plea/sentencing.   Court said that the victim not required to file a victim impact statement, may make a statement in court.  State requesting time to request a special prosecutor. Set date for hearing on appointment of a special prosecutor.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 6, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.
